snippet: Mayoral candidates received $14 million in matching funds, according to a report by the New York City Campaign Finance Board to be released Tuesday.
abstract: New York City Campaign Finance Board analysis shows that mayoral candidates received $14 million in matching funds in 2013 race, most in program’s 25-year history; it was first time since 1997, last mayoral election without Michael R Bloomberg, that top two candidates in the general election received matching funds.
lead_paragraph: Mayoral candidates received $14 million in matching funds, according to a report by the New York City Campaign Finance Board to be released Tuesday.

headline.main: Small Donations Fueled ‘Most Wide-Open’ Mayoral Race Last Year, Board Says
headline.print_headline: Small Donations and Matching Funds Opened Up ’13 Mayoral Race, Board Says
